frameDefinitions: This frame contains words that describe a set of individuals which possess some Commonality, generally a common attribute.
A Member is semi-permanently part of a socially constructed Group.
In this frame a State_of_affairs is prohibited (or allowed) by a Principle.
AForgoer decides not to partake in something ordinary that is otherwise Desirable.
A Proprietor owns or runs a Business which provides a Product (which may be goods or services).
An Item is the only instance of its Type.
frameExamples: Victor is <t>part</t> of the Red Crescent
The consumer electronics <t>company</t> Apple has exploded with popularity in recent years.
Steven is the <t>sole</t> survivor in his family.
listRoleDefinitions: This role denotes the people in possession of the Commonality. This role is usually genetive, the object of a postnominal PP, or null instantiated (INI), and null instantiaton often implies the public at large, as in 'the common good'.
This role denotes an object or attribute which is jointly posessed by the <fen>Entities</fen>.
One of the possesors of the <fen>Commonality</fen>. Can be singular or plural.
One of the possesors of the <fen>Commonality</fen>. Can be singular or plural.
The person who belongs to a <fen>Group</fen>.
A set of people standing in a semi-permanent relationship together.
The time at which the <fen>Member</fen> is a member of the <fen>Group</fen>.
The location where the membership relationship holds.
A moral, legal, or social norm which rules a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> to be inadmissible behavior or an outcome of behavior.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the prohibiting occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the prohibiting occurs.
The <fen>Forgoer</fen> decides not to partake in the desirable activity or event.
<fen>Desirable</fen> identifies the event or activity in which is the <fen>Forgoer</fen> does not partake.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the the forgoing occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the forgoing occurs.
<fen>Business</fen> identifies the company or establishment. This may be the target itself or the <fen>Business_Name</fen> if it is an appositive not set off with commas (i.e. restrictive):
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> in which the business is located.
An <fen>Item</fen> is alone in its category.
<fen>Type</fen> specifies a category which in principle could apply to multiple items, but which is limited to the <fen>Item</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Their shared <fex>parents</fex> were their only similarity.
Two <fex>members</fex> of the Red Cross were here about a donation

<fex>The Establishment Clause of the First Amendment</fex> plainly prohibits the
establishment of a national religion by Congress.
